turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nothing, he's trying to brainwash me and give me personality doubts ... oh, he's a swine but a clever swine, mind.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: She's going to show me her stamp collection.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We've got only half an hour till the final run-through. He can't walk out on us.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Can't he? He's done it, son!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well, I got a few things to say to you, two-faced John McCartney.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Aw, leave him alone Paul, he's back, isn't he? And it's not his fault he's old.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What's old got to do with it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Practising to be thick-headed, you're there already.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Look he's a mixer and a trouble maker!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's right, but he's only asking us to pay attention to him, aren't you?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Are you listening to me, Lennon?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're a swine, isn't he George?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: If you're going to have a barney I'll hold your coats.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Eh, have you got Paul's grandfather?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Of course, he's concealed about me person.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: No ... he's must have slipped off somewhere.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Don't move, any of you. They've gone potty out there. The whole place is surging with girls.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Please, can I have one to surge with?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: No, you can't. Look, as soon as I tell you, run through this door here and into the big car that's waiting.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Paul, John, George - get at it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hello the income tax have caught up with us at last.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh, it's got round that you're a heavy punter.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's all right for you, you couldn't get a pen in your foot, you swine.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Come on, Shake, we'll leave 'em to their penmanship.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We were going to do it.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Will you all stop it, you're like a gang of school kids. I knew this was going to happen one day.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, you shouldn't have had bacon for your breakfast, you cannibal.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Don't cane me, sir, I was led astray.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Oh shurrup and come on John. They're waiting for you in the studio.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Leave him alone, he's got swine fever.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Sit down, the lot of you.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Leave him alone, Lennon, or I'll tell them all the truth about you.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: They're nearly ready for you. They're just finishing the band call.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Gear! Come on, girls, let's have a bit of a dance.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: John, I'm talking to you. This final run through is <U>important</U>. Understand? Important.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Control yourself or you'll spurt. He's bound to be somewhere.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Aye, let's try the dressing room.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: The office was on the phone, they think it'd be better if we pushed straight to Wolverhampton.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: No, you look here, John. I've only one thing to say to you.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: You're a swine. So hurry up ... we're travelling!

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Oh, wait a minute, don't tell me you're ...

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Oh you are, I know you are.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh do I? You're the first one who ever said that.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Well, yes your nose is. Very.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Aye, but you know him well.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: No I don't, he's only a casual acquaintance.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's all over the place, everyone knows.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Mind you, I stood up for you, I mean I wouldn't have it.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: I knew I could rely on you.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Well, that's just your opinion. Do I snore, Paul?

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: It'll only get you into trouble.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: That's right. It's always me, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Since you ask, yes.  Aah, come on, Ring, we love you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well, look after him. I don't want to find you've lost him.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Don't be cheeky, I'll bind him to me with promises. Come on, Grandad.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Your Grandfather pointed out Shake was always being taller than me just to spite me.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I knew it, <U>he</U> started it, I should have known.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You two have never had a quarrel in your life and in two minutes flat he's got you at it. He's a king mixer. Adam and Eve, meet the serpent. Anthony and Cleopatra, there's your asp. Divide and Conquer, that's this one's motto. He hates group unity so he gets everyone at it.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Don't worry about him. He can look after himself.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: I've got the stuff. Come here.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Ah well, there you go. Look, I'm going down the diner for a cup of coffee, are you coming?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Have done, and you lot get your pens out.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: When I tell you to stay put, stay put.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Oh dear, I feel like doing a bit of work.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: I don't need you to defend me, y'know, Norm.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: What do you think are you're up to?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Do I have to raise me voice?

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Oh, all right. Come here, Grandad.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Yeah, you want to watch it.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Well, you stick to that story, son.

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: I can't help it, I'm just taller than you.

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: I'm sorry Norm, but I can't help being taller than you.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Well, you don't have to rub me nose in it. I've a good mind to ...

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: He's been gone a long time.

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: Oh, I didn't notice, where'd he go?

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: Well, give a couple of minutes ...

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: Oh they've probably gone to the canteen, cup of tea, like.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: He's out there somewhere, causing trouble just to upset me.

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: You're imagining it. You're letting things prey on your mind.

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Oh no... this is a battle of nerves between John and me.

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: I'm adjusting the decibels on the inbalance.

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: ... as they head up for the show. Oh yes, well I mean it'ud be a pity to miss the show, wouldn't it like.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Oh ... he's nursing a broken heart.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Course he can talk. He's a human being, like. Isn't he?

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Well ... if he's your Grandfather, who knows?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: "The Management of Boyd's takes pleasure in requesting the company of Mr. Richard Starkey, that's you, in their recently refinished gaming rooms. Chemin de Fer. Baccarat, Roulette, and Champagne Buffet." Blimey!

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Oh, he's gone to my club, has he?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yeah, It's all your fault, getting invites to gambling clubs. He's probably in the middle of an orgy by now.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What's the matter with you? You were bashing away like a madman.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Eh. I thought you were looking after the old man.

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: Put it this way, he's mislaid him.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You can't trust you with anything, Norm, if you've lost him, I'll cripple you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Shove the gentleman jockey in the make-up room or something and keep your eye on him, will you?

turns.speaker: SHAKE
turns.text: I'm an electrician, not a wet nurse, y'know.

turns.speaker: POLICEMAN
turns.text: I've got a little list here. Wandering abroad. Malicious intent. Acting in a suspicious manner. Conduct liable to cause a breach of the peace. You name it, he's done it.

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Oh, a little savage, is he?

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: So you just brought the old chap out of the crowd for his own good.

turns.speaker: POLICEMAN
turns.text: Yeah, but he insisted on us bringing him to the station.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: I'm going to buy a cattle ranch.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: I'm not kidding.  You can get one if you have the credit.  Look just like real cows, too.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: If there is some kind of alien intelligence down on that planetoid, it'd be a serious mistake for us to blunder in unequipped.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Hell, no!  We don't know what's down there on that piece of rock!  It might be dangerous!  What we should do is get on the radio to the exploration authorities... and let them deal with it.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Nine hundred meters and dropping. 800.  700.  Hang on gentlemen.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Good!  Maybe we'll be able to see something then.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Or something will be able to see us.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: There could be a whole city out there and we'd never see it.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Not sitting on our butts in here, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Not exactly, just feel like somebody's been beating me with rubber hoses for about six years.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Dell, what's the last thing you can remember?

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: No.  Just some horrible dreams about smothering.  Where are we?

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Just short of Zeta II Reticuli.  We haven't even reached the outer rim yet.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Can you get it a little closer?

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: That's what I'm going to do.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Point eight six.  We can walk on it.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Except it will take 75 years to get a reply back.  Don't forget how far we are from the Colonies, Martin.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: There are no commercial lanes out here.  Face it, we're out of range.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Dell, I want greater magnification. More surface detail.  I want to see what this place looks like.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: I'll see what I can do.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Activated.  Vertical drop checked. Correcting course.  On tangential course now, orbiting.  Crossing the terminator.  Entering night side.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Approaching point of origin.  Closing at 20 kilometers, 15 and slowing. Ten.  Five.  Gentlemen, we are directly above the source of the transmission.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Well, line of sight is impossible due to dust.  Radar gives me noise. Sonar gives me noise.  Infrared -- noise.  Let's try ultraviolet.  There. Flat.  It's totally flat.  A plain.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Drop begins... now!  Fifteen kilometers and dropping... twelve... ten... eight and slowing.  Five. Three.  Two.  One kilometer and slowing.  Lock tractor beams.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Martin, would you run me an atmospheric?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I'm sending.  Do you hear me?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Appears to be a door hanging open, the entrance is clogged with debris.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Martin, we're going in.  I'm going to hold the conversation to a minimum from here on.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Chaz, this is Dell.  Can you come topside for a minute?

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Well, the sun just came up again, and it seems the wind's died down. It's as clear as a bell outside. There's something I think you ought to see.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: I was scanning the horizon to see what I could pick up.  Look there, on that screen.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Maybe we can get in by the top.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: No, it's too small, only room enough for one person.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Can you see anything in the hole?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Dell, you want to come down, we can figure out where to go from here.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: No, I want to go in.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Okay, I'm in the mouth of the chimney now, and I'm starting down.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Yeah, I'm okay.  Haven't hit bottom yet.  Definitely a column of warm air rising; it keeps the shaft clear of dust.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: What was that Dell, I lost you, do you read me?

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Yeah, but this is hard work.  Can't talk now.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: Don't remember nothing.  Can't hardly remember my name.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Hell, you're in great shape, you've got your sense of humor back!

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: I'm really starving; can we get some food before we go into the freezers?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I think that's a pretty reasonable request.

turns.speaker: BROUSSARD
turns.text: I don't know... I'm getting these <u>CRAMPS</u>!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Computer, this is Captain Standard. What conditions are you talking about?

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: I have intercepted a transmission of unknown origin.
